Uses of Class
com.srch2.android.http.service.Query

    • Uses of Query in com.srch2.android.http.service

      Methods in com.srch2.android.http.service that return Query 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected Query Query.facetOn(String fieldName)
      TODO future release Please note: facet must also be enabled from the configuration file by setting the "facetEnabled" tag to true.
      protected Query Query.facetOn(String fieldName, int rows)
      Control how many rows to fetch
      protected Query Query.facetOnRange(String fieldName, String start, String end, String gap)
      TODO future release Note that all start, end, and gap values, if given in the query, will override the corresponding values in the configuration file.
      Query Query.filterByFieldEndsTo(String fieldName, String endValue)
      It allows us to match records whose field value ends at a specified upper bound.
      Query Query.filterByFieldEqualsTo(String fieldName, String equalToValue)
      Creates a query doing a filtered search.
      Query Query.filterByFieldInRange(String fieldName, String startValue, String endValue)
      It allows us to match records whose field value is between a specified lower bound and upper bound (both inclusive)
      Query Query.filterByFieldStartsFrom(String fieldName, String startValue)
      It allows us to match records whose field value starts from a specified lower bound.
      Query Query.insideBoxRegion(double leftBottomLatitude, double leftBottomLongitude, double rightTopLatitude, double rightTopLongitude)
      Get the GeoLocation search by specify a bounding box.
      Query Query.insideCircleRegion(double centerLatitude, double centerLongitude, double radius)
      Get the GeoLocation search by specify a center point and a radius.
      Query Query.orderByAscending()
      It specifies the order in which the result set should be sorted.
      Query Query.orderByDescending()
      It specifies the order in which the result set should be sorted.
      Query Query.pagingSize(int sizePerPage)
      It indicates the number of records to return from the complete result set.
      Query Query.pagingStartFrom(int startOffset)
      It is the offset in the complete result set of the query, where the set of returned records should begin.
      Query Query.setFilterRelationAND()
      Note: the engine supports only one kind of boolean operator (OR or AND) between all the filter terms.
      Query Query.setFilterRelationOR()
      Note: the engine supports only one kind of boolean operator (OR or AND) between all the filter terms.
      Query Query.sortOnFields(String field1, String... restFields)
      The engine's default behavior is to sort the results using a descending order by the overall score of each record.
      Methods in com.srch2.android.http.service with parameters of type Query 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Indexable.advancedSearch(Query query)
      Does an advanced search by forming search request input as a Query.
      static void SRCH2Engine.advancedSearchIndex(String indexName, Query query)
      Performs an advanced search on the specific Indexable with the associated index name (that was defined in the IndexDescription that was returned by getIndexableDescription()).
      static void SRCH2Engine.advancedSearchOnAllIndexes(Query query)
      Performs an advanced searches on all Indexables that were initialized when included in the argument set of the method call SRCH2Engine.initialize(...); that is, this method makes performing an advanced search on all indexes at once easy.
